meanings.definition: The quality or state of being fictional.
meanings.sent1: The fictionality of the story made it enjoyable to read.
meanings.sent2: Many people enjoy the fictionality of fantasy novels.
meanings.sent3: The fictionality of the talking animals in the book brought a smile to my face.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination soared as she embraced the fictionality of the magical world.
meanings.sent5: The fictionality of the characters made them unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The concept or idea of something being fictional.
meanings.sent1: The fictionality of the movie plot was evident from the start.
meanings.sent2: Discussing the fictionality of the superhero's powers sparked a lively debate.
meanings.sent3: The fictionality of the alien invasion story kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: She marveled at the fictionality of the time-travel concept in the novel.
meanings.sent5: The fictionality of the detective's deductions added an element of mystery to the story.
